filmography.title: Brother Rat
filmography.role_description: The love interest of a cadet in this military comedy, notable for being the film where she met her future husband, Ronald Reagan.
filmography.plot: Three cadets at the Virginia Military Institute try to get out of trouble before the big baseball game.

filmography.title: Torchy Blane.. Playing with Dynamite
filmography.role_description: A fast-talking female reporter who gets herself thrown in jail to get a scoop on a bank robber.
filmography.plot: Reporter Torchy Blane intentionally gets arrested to interview a gangster's girlfriend in prison.

filmography.title: You're in the Army Now
filmography.role_description: A woman who shares a record-breaking 3-minute and 5-second on-screen kiss with Regis Toomey.
filmography.plot: Two vacuum cleaner salesmen accidentally enlist in the Army and cause chaos during training.

filmography.title: Larceny, Inc.
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a criminal associate who helps run a luggage shop that serves as a front for a bank robbery.
filmography.plot: Three ex-convicts buy a luggage store to rob the bank next door but find themselves becoming respected pillars of the community.

filmography.title: Princess O'Rourke
filmography.role_description: A European princess who travels incognito to the US and falls in love with a pilot, played by Robert Cummings.
filmography.plot: A princess in exile in New York City falls for a pilot who doesn't know she is royalty.

filmography.title: The Doughgirls
filmography.role_description: One of three newlywed women struggling to find housing in overcrowded wartime Washington D.C.
filmography.plot: Three women trying to legitimize their marriages share a hotel room in Washington D.C. during WWII.

filmography.title: The Lost Weekend
filmography.role_description: The devoted and long-suffering girlfriend of an alcoholic writer, trying to save him from self-destruction.
filmography.plot: The desperate life of a chronic alcoholic is followed through a four-day drinking bout.

filmography.title: Night and Day
filmography.role_description: The wife of composer Cole Porter in this fictionalized musical biography.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized biography of Cole Porter, following his career from Yale to Broadway stardom.

filmography.title: The Yearling
filmography.role_description: A hardened, stoic pioneer woman who struggles to show affection due to the loss of her previous children.
filmography.plot: A boy persuades his parents to allow him to adopt a young deer, but the animal's growth causes problems for the family's crops.

filmography.title: Cheyenne
filmography.role_description: A gambler's wife who gets involved with a drifter attempting to capture an outlaw known as 'The Poet'.
filmography.plot: A gambler tries to capture an outlaw who leaves poetic notes at the scene of his stagecoach robberies.

filmography.title: Magic Town
filmography.role_description: A newspaper editor who clashes with a pollster who discovers her town is the statistical 'average' of America.
filmography.plot: A pollster discovers a town that perfectly mirrors US public opinion, but his presence threatens to ruin its perfection.

filmography.title: Johnny Belinda
filmography.role_description: A deaf-mute woman living on a farm who faces prejudice and trauma, delivering a powerful silent performance.
filmography.plot: A doctor teaches a deaf-mute farm girl sign language, but she faces tragedy when she is assaulted and becomes pregnant.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: A Kiss in the Dark
filmography.role_description: A fashion model who falls for a timid concert pianist who has just bought the apartment building she lives in.
filmography.plot: A concert pianist buys an apartment building and gets involved in the lives of his eccentric tenants.

filmography.title: Stage Fright
filmography.role_description: An aspiring actress who goes undercover as a maid to prove her friend's innocence in a murder case.
filmography.plot: A struggling actress tries to help a friend prove his innocence when he's accused of murdering the husband of a high-society star.

filmography.title: The Glass Menagerie
filmography.role_description: The painfully shy, limping daughter who collects glass figurines in this adaptation of Tennessee Williams' play.
filmography.plot: A son tries to support his mother and crippled sister in St. Louis during the Depression.

filmography.title: Three Guys Named Mike
filmography.role_description: A flight attendant who finds herself courted by three different men named Mike.
filmography.plot: An airline stewardess is pursued by three men with the same first name: a pilot, a professor, and an ad man.

filmography.title: Here Comes the Groom
filmography.role_description: A woman engaged to a millionaire who is pursued by her ex-fiancé (Bing Crosby) who needs to marry quickly to keep adopted orphans.
filmography.plot: A reporter has to find a bride in five days in order to keep the two orphans he adopted.

filmography.title: The Blue Veil
filmography.role_description: A widow who loses her own child and dedicates her life to being a nursemaid for other people's children.
filmography.plot: After losing her own baby, a woman devotes her life to caring for other people's children as a nanny.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: The Story of Will Rogers
filmography.role_description: The supportive wife of the famous humorist Will Rogers, played by his real-life son.
filmography.plot: The biography of the American humorist Will Rogers, from his early days in Oklahoma to his death in a plane crash.

filmography.title: Just for You
filmography.role_description: A Broadway star who helps a busy producer reconnect with his neglected children.
filmography.plot: A successful Broadway producer realizes he has neglected his teenage children and tries to win back their affection.

filmography.title: So Big
filmography.role_description: A teacher who becomes a truck farmer to support her son, facing hardships and sacrifices.
filmography.plot: A woman raises her son alone on a truck farm outside Chicago, hoping he will become an architect.

filmography.title: Magnificent Obsession
filmography.role_description: A widow who is blinded in an accident caused by a reckless playboy, who later becomes a surgeon to cure her.
filmography.plot: A reckless playboy is responsible for the death of a doctor and the blindness of his widow, leading him to seek redemption.

filmography.title: All That Heaven Allows
filmography.role_description: A wealthy widow who falls in love with her younger gardener, facing social ostracization from her friends and children.
filmography.plot: An upper-class widow falls in love with a much younger, down-to-earth nurseryman, much to the disapproval of her children and peers.

filmography.title: Lucy Gallant
filmography.role_description: A determined woman who builds a successful fashion business in an oil boomtown while resisting romance.
filmography.plot: A jilted woman moves to an oil town and opens a high-end dress shop, attracting the attention of a rancher.

filmography.title: Miracle in the Rain
filmography.role_description: A lonely secretary who finds love with a soldier in New York City before he ships out to WWII.
filmography.plot: A lonely woman falls in love with a soldier she meets in the rain, but their romance is cut short by the war.

filmography.title: Pollyanna
filmography.role_description: The stern, wealthy aunt who takes in her orphaned niece, whose optimism eventually melts her cold heart.
filmography.plot: A young girl comes to an embittered town and confronts its attitude with her determination to see the best in life.

filmography.title: How to Commit Marriage
filmography.role_description: A woman who decides to divorce her husband just as their daughter gets engaged; Wyman's final film role.
filmography.plot: A couple plans to divorce but puts it on hold for their daughter's wedding, only to find their daughter plans to live in sin.
